intro: Daucus humilis, commonly known as the dwarf carrot, is a small, herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like parsley and celery. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are thin and not typically used as food, but the plant is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. Daucus humilis is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open, sunny areas.
